e2e-tests/pr/wl-pet-food-tests/wl-pet-food-multi-pet-checkout/multiPetCheckout.spec.ts & 
e2e-tests/pr/wl-pet-food-tests/wl-pet-food-onboarding/petFoodOnboardingFlow.spec.ts`

Confirmed with Dovas, that the meals showed up after refreshing. I believe the request to render the meals was not completed before loading the dashboard.

We should probably add this as a requirement for the new reactivation page.

_thread_replies.text: <@U01PE2S4ZL6> I was testing from <http://thepetstable.com|thepetstable.com>, but when I test from the instapage Dovas shared autofill doesn't work for me, so it's an issue with Instapage

thepetstable.com
, but when I test from the instapage Dovas shared autofill doesn't work for me, so it's an issue with Instapage

_thread_replies.text:
We were still unable to trigger that popup directly, but based on our reasoning we are quite confident that LP is the culprit here.

Wunderkind stores email in a very fragile way, that can be wiped out when navigating between different pages. Because LP and "regular" tpt page are technically two different websites, we have a strong suspicion that this value gets wiped out and becomes inaccessible after you leave the instapage LP.

I glanced over the wunderkind documentation, but I haven't found much helpful info on other methods of getting the email value from Wunderkind. It may be that we will need help from their support in that regard

elements.text:
We were still unable to trigger that popup directly, but based on our reasoning we are quite confident that LP is the culprit here.

Wunderkind stores email in a very fragile way, that can be wiped out when navigating between different pages. Because LP and "regular" tpt page are technically two different websites, we have a strong suspicion that this value gets wiped out and becomes inaccessible after you leave the instapage LP.

I glanced over the wunderkind documentation, but I haven't found much helpful info on other methods of getting the email value from Wunderkind. It may be that we will need help from their support in that regard

_thread_replies.text: <@U01PE2S4ZL6> I can ask them about this, they had mentioned that whatever work they previously did would enable the email to pass from Instapage to signup

elements.text: I can ask them about this, they had mentioned that whatever work they previously did would enable the email to pass from Instapage to signup

_thread_replies.text: Not being able to pass an email from a different subdomain to the main domain was a known issue for years but sounded like there was a solution now :thinking_face:

elements.text: Not being able to pass an email from a different subdomain to the main domain was a known issue for years but sounded like there was a solution now

_thread_replies.text: would be good to connect everyone via email and also ask <@U06Q01E5BNZ> for his POV

elements.text: would be good to connect everyone via email and also ask
for his POV

_thread_replies.text: The way we obtain email from wunderkind is through a window object function: `window.boucex.infoStore.get()` . The details of how wunderkind interacts with these variables is unknown to me, but typically variables set on window object do not persist when navigating between different pages (exception is tpt website, because we use "SPA navigation"). So that's our best hypothesis for this moment given the limited visibility we have over wunderkind setup

elements.text: The way we obtain email from wunderkind is through a window object function:
window.boucex.infoStore.get()

. The details of how wunderkind interacts with these variables is unknown to me, but typically variables set on window object do not persist when navigating between different pages (exception is tpt website, because we use "SPA navigation"). So that's our best hypothesis for this moment given the limited visibility we have over wunderkind setup

_thread_replies.text: <@U01PE2S4ZL6> Yeah that tracks with what we've seen in HF as well. We've also had consistency issues pulling from the `window.bouncex.infoStore.get()` property. We had some success by attempting to save the email values from the window object and storing them in localStorage before we get to the registration form, but testing is difficult because we're unable to trigger the Wunderkind modal outside of a production environment.

elements.text: Yeah that tracks with what we've seen in HF as well. We've also had consistency issues pulling from the
window.bouncex.infoStore.get()

property. We had some success by attempting to save the email values from the window object and storing them in localStorage before we get to the registration form, but testing is difficult because we're unable to trigger the Wunderkind modal outside of a production environment.

_thread_replies.text: We could have an attempt with local storage, or cookie or even url query param, but that would need to be set on instapage, and opens a whole new topic of how do we make this happen on instapage. As of now I have no ability to trigger wunderkind, and I have no control over instapage code. I feel like this whole task requires some dedicated investigation, starting with getting access to all those environments. cc <@U03UMPD2NNS> <@U8F7ZDAPM>

elements.text: We could have an attempt with local storage, or cookie or even url query param, but that would need to be set on instapage, and opens a whole new topic of how do we make this happen on instapage. As of now I have no ability to trigger wunderkind, and I have no control over instapage code. I feel like this whole task requires some dedicated investigation, starting with getting access to all those environments. cc

_thread_replies.text:
Hey team, I need to point out that this is different than our original understanding of the task since we thought we were talking about wunderkind strictly within the context of our website, we weren't aware that landing pages are involved. Not to say that we can't do that but just explaining that this is an additional task.

Regarding how to proceed, we can create another ticket to implement this but as Mateusz mentioned we're going to need this data to be passed to our website somehow. So on the landing page either wunderkind or instapages need to <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18492576/share-cookies-between-subdomain-and-domain|set a cookie for our domain> with the value of the email, only after that can we access this data on our app

elements.text:
Hey team, I need to point out that this is different than our original understanding of the task since we thought we were talking about wunderkind strictly within the context of our website, we weren't aware that landing pages are involved. Not to say that we can't do that but just explaining that this is an additional task.

Regarding how to proceed, we can create another ticket to implement this but as Mateusz mentioned we're going to need this data to be passed to our website somehow. So on the landing page either wunderkind or instapages need to
set a cookie for our domain
with the value of the email, only after that can we access this data on our app

_thread_replies.text: Maybe it got lost somewhere in communications as almost all paid traffic goes through the Instapage landing pages. I flagged it early on that with EveryPlate we were never able to make this work but I was told there is a fix for that now, hence the expectation. Is there a way to make it work though?

elements.text: Maybe it got lost somewhere in communications as almost all paid traffic goes through the Instapage landing pages. I flagged it early on that with EveryPlate we were never able to make this work but I was told there is a fix for that now, hence the expectation. Is there a way to make it work though?

_thread_replies.text:
The only way is what I mentioned here:
> Regarding how to proceed, we can create another ticket to implement this but as Mateusz mentioned we're going to need this data to be passed to our website somehow. So on the landing page either wunderkind or instapages need to <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18492576/share-cookies-between-subdomain-and-domain|set a cookie for our domain> with the value of the email, only after that can we access this data on our app
Technically the instapage landing page is a completely different website, there are only 3 ways to share information between different websites:
 Storing a cookie (recommended in this case)
 Pass url param (easy but it might be too insecure to pass email in the url)
 Save it on the backend (too much effort and might be overkill for what we need)

elements.text: The only way is what I mentioned here:

Regarding how to proceed, we can create another ticket to implement this but as Mateusz mentioned we're going to need this data to be passed to our website somehow. So on the landing page either wunderkind or instapages need to
set a cookie for our domain
with the value of the email, only after that can we access this data on our app
Technically the instapage landing page is a completely different website, there are only 3 ways to share information between different websites:
Storing a cookie (recommended in this case)
Pass url param (easy but it might be too insecure to pass email in the url)
Save it on the backend (too much effort and might be overkill for what we need)

_thread_replies.text: Confirming I flagged this back in May that it needs to be passed from Landing Pages and <@U06Q01E5BNZ> mentioned he was seeing the same experience:

elements.text: Confirming I flagged this back in May that it needs to be passed from Landing Pages and
mentioned he was seeing the same experience:

_thread_replies.text: I see what you mean but I dont think its super clear even in that conversation. Either way something to carry with us in the future is to always re-affirm requirements and be as specific as possible, especially since as we can see here there can be quite a big gap between when the initial discussion is had and when the actual development begins (4 months in this case). All in all no harm done here would just help to reduce confusion

_thread_replies.text:
<@U3XBWJ3ND>, I shared with you the pre-post query for Databricks so that you can review the numbers, I won't have the bandwidth to run the data this or next week. I'm prioritizing key prios for the upcoming sprint, and preparing handover before my holidays.

The request to enable email prefilling is a separate item that was beyond the requirements shared initially. Mateusz fully delivered on his task to pass the email. If we want to prioritize it next sprint, we will need to trade off sth from: changing daily calories, making the mixed plan more prominent or showing cash credits.

For now, I recommend we test a different approach: let's remove the email capture from the landing page altogether and enable this only in TPT urls. This will help us understand how lead quantity and especially quality might change and allow us to scope and prioritize the LP element.

elements.text:
, I shared with you the pre-post query for Databricks so that you can review the numbers, I won't have the bandwidth to run the data this or next week. I'm prioritizing key prios for the upcoming sprint, and preparing handover before my holidays.

The request to enable email prefilling is a separate item that was beyond the requirements shared initially. Mateusz fully delivered on his task to pass the email. If we want to prioritize it next sprint, we will need to trade off sth from: changing daily calories, making the mixed plan more prominent or showing cash credits.

For now, I recommend we test a different approach: let's remove the email capture from the landing page altogether and enable this only in TPT urls. This will help us understand how lead quantity and especially quality might change and allow us to scope and prioritize the LP element.

_thread_replies.text: <@U03UMPD2NNS> just wanted to follow up as Wunderkind said you can access email data from instapage using `bouncex.infoStore.get()`, which returns an object containing the email the user submitted.

elements.text: just wanted to follow up as Wunderkind said you can access email data from instapage using
bouncex.infoStore.get()
, which returns an object containing the email the user submitted.

_thread_replies.text: <!subteam^S05K3MZSD55> if anyone is available to provide the accurate meal selection in next 3 hours that would be great, otherwise i cant get the trial box out

elements.text: if anyone is available to provide the accurate meal selection in next 3 hours that would be great, otherwise i cant get the trial box out

_thread_replies.text: I'll have a look into it :eyes:

elements.text: I'll have a look into it

_thread_replies.text:
`3121057 (trial box):` they had an incorrect meal selection saved upon checkout.
This occurred when they selected a Dry plan with meals > proceeded with signup > then returned to change their Dry plan to a Mix plan *without* reselecting their meals. Since they were logged in, they were able to bypass meal selection during checkout, resulting in the previous meal selection being saved with the incorrect plan.
Good news is that after checking our traces as far as 60 days I can tell that this was the only instance of a mixed plan user having a single protein meal saved when checking out so this is an edge case, created a ticket to fix this
<https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/TPT-2129>

`3085754`: what was their incorrect meal selection (can we please always include this info in the future?)
What I can see on BOB they selected index 7 which is a valid meal selection (Fresh Chicken & Dry Beef)

`3093515`: the request to update the users' meal selection to index 77 failed when user was switching plans (will look into why exactly separately) however their request to update the plan (subscription) was successful. Since these requests are separate requests and not possible to synchronize together the user ended up with inconsistent state between plan type and meal selection. This is an intended flow for when the save meals request fails and in these cases we display a banner prompting the user to update their meals which the user didn't do. I'll trigger the correct meal selection (77) for this user so it's persisted for future deliveries

<@U0139TY5FDF> can you reach out to the trial box user (`3121057` ) asking them to go in and update their meals manually?

This is an intended flow for when the save meals request fails and in these cases we display a banner prompting the user to update their meals which the user didn't do. I'll trigger the correct meal selection (77) for this user so it's persisted for future deliveries

_thread_replies.text: fyi when these are flagged its in the couple of hours between order processing and odl generation. Its sometimes caught after Berlin hours so I get if it cant be the same day, but we do need responses within 24 hours so we can start customer comms for the ones I cant fix. At this point all boxes are supposed to have been delivered for the week, so customers are already very confused

_thread_replies.text: Hey Jordan, yes this does sound like something we would want to address quickly. The investigation into why the invalid selection happened usually takes more time but we can separate that from just identifying the valid selections for these users to unblock their deliveries. Will keep it in mind for future occurrences and I will also be updating our issue reporting to include priority since right now it's not always clear at a glance whenever someone reports something

elements.text: Hey Jordan, yes this does sound like something we would want to address quickly. The investigation into why the invalid selection happened usually takes more time but we can separate that from just identifying the valid selections for these users to unblock their deliveries. Will keep it in mind for future occurrences and I will also be updating our issue reporting to include priority since right now it's not always clear at a glance whenever someone reports something
